statements.name: PROC SGPIE
statements.description: Identifies the data set that contains the plot variables. The statement also gives you the option to specify a description, control automatic legends, and specify whether the chart background is opaque or transparent.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data set that contains the variables to process.

arguments.name: DATTRMAP=
arguments.description: specifies the discrete attribute map data set that you want to use with the procedure.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description for the output image.

arguments.name: NOAUTOLEGEND
arguments.description: disables automatic legends from being generated.

arguments.name: OPAQUE
arguments.description: specifies whether the graph background is opaque or transparent.

arguments.name: NOOPAQUE
arguments.description: specifies whether the graph background is opaque or transparent.

statements.name: DONUT
statements.description: Creates a donut chart with slices representing counts or percents of unique category values. If a RESPONSE variable is specified, the chart summarizes the category values over corresponding values of the RESPONSE variable.

arguments.name: category-variable
arguments.description: specifies the column for the category values.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set.

arguments.name: DATALABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the color and font attributes of the slice labels.

arguments.name: DATALABELDISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies the information to display in the slice labels.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: displays all available information

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: does not display slice labels

arguments.name: CATEGORY
arguments.description: displays the category value.

arguments.name: RESPONSE
arguments.description: displays the sum of the response value for each category.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: displays either of the following:

arguments.name: DATALABELLOC=
arguments.description: specifies whether to display the slice labels within the slices or outside of the donut circumference.

arguments.name: INSIDE
arguments.description: locates the slice labels inside the slices.

arguments.name: OUTSIDE
arguments.description: locates the slice labels outside of the donut circumference.

arguments.name: CALLOUT
arguments.description: locates the slice labels outside of the donut circumference and draws a line from the label to its slice.

arguments.name: DATASKIN=
arguments.description: enhances the visual appearance of the filled donut slices.
arguments.help: DATASKIN=NONE | CRISP | GLOSS | MATTE | PRESSED | SHEEN

arguments.name: DIRECTION=
arguments.description: specifies whether to display the donut slices in counterclockwise or clockwise sequence.

arguments.name: FILLPATTERN
arguments.description: enables the display of line fill patterns for the chart.

arguments.name: HOLELABEL
arguments.description: displays a label for the donut hole.

arguments.name: HOLELABEL=
arguments.description: displays a label for the donut hole.

arguments.name: HOLELABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies text attributes for the label text in the donut hole.

arguments.name: HOLEVALUE
arguments.description: displays a numeric value inside the donut hole.

arguments.name: HOLEVALUE=
arguments.description: displays a numeric value inside the donut hole.

arguments.name: HOLEVALUEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies text attributes for the value text in the donut hole.

arguments.name: MAXSLICES=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of slices in the donut. Any remaining slices are consolidated into the Other slice.

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: shows the data for missing category values.

arguments.name: NOFILL
arguments.description: turns off the display of fill colors.

arguments.name: OTHERFILLATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill color and transparency of the Other slice.

arguments.name: OTHERLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a label for the Other slice.

arguments.name: OTHERPERCENT=
arguments.description: collects all category values with response values less than or equal to percent-of-total into the Other slice.

arguments.name: RESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable for the response values.

arguments.name: RINGSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the proportion of the donut radius to be occupied by the donut ring.

arguments.name: SLICEORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order of the donut slices.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: draws the slices in data order.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: draws the slices in ascending order of the formatted category variable.

arguments.name: UNFORMATTED
arguments.description: draws the slices in ascending order of the unformatted category variable.

arguments.name: RESPASC
arguments.description: draws the slices in ascending summed order of the response variable.

arguments.name: RESPDESC
arguments.description: draws the slices in descending summed order of the response variable.

arguments.name: STARTANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies which degree between 0 and 360 serves as the starting position for the first slice.

arguments.name: STARTPOS=
arguments.description: specifies whether the center or the edge of the slice is positioned at the start angle.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: specifies the format of the displayed statistical value.

arguments.name: TIP=
arguments.description: specifies the data tip information to be displayed when the cursor is positioned over the graphics element.

arguments.name: (variable-list)
arguments.description: a space-separated list of variables enclosed in parentheses.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses the data tips from this chart.

arguments.name: TIPFORMAT=
arguments.description: applies formats to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TIPLABEL=
arguments.description: applies labels to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies an HTML page to be displayed when parts of the plot are selected.

arguments.name: character-variable
arguments.description: specifies a variable that contains a valid HTML page reference (HREF) for each plot element that is to have an active link.

statements.name: KEYLEGEND
statements.description: Creates a legend based on information from pie and donut statements. This statement is used to control the automated legend when it is displayed.

arguments.name: ACROSS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of columns in the legend.

arguments.name: AUTOITEMSIZE
arguments.description: specifies that all swatches in the legend are sized in proportion to the font size used for the legend value labels.

arguments.name: BORDER
arguments.description: specifies whether a border is displayed around the legend.

arguments.name: NOBORDER
arguments.description: specifies whether a border is displayed around the legend.

arguments.name: DOWN=
arguments.description: specifies the number of rows in the legend.

arguments.name: FILLASPECT=
arguments.description: specifies an aspect ratio for the fill swatches based on their height.

arguments.name: GOLDEN
arguments.description: specifies the golden ratio of 1.618 (width = 1.618 * height).

arguments.name: positive-number
arguments.description: specifies a custom aspect ratio.

arguments.name: FILLHEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height of the fill swatches.

arguments.name: POSITION=
arguments.description: specifies the position of the legend within the graph.

arguments.name: BOTTOM
arguments.description: places the legend at the bottom of the graph.

arguments.name: BOTTOMLEFT
arguments.description: places the legend at the bottom left corner of the graph.

arguments.name: BOTTOMRIGHT
arguments.description: places the legend at the bottom right corner of the graph.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: places the legend at the left side of the graph.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: places the legend at the right side of the graph.

arguments.name: TOP
arguments.description: places the legend at the top of the graph.

arguments.name: TOPLEFT
arguments.description: places the legend at the top left corner of the graph.

arguments.name: TOPRIGHT
arguments.description: places the legend at the top right corner of the graph.

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: specifies a scale factor that is to be applied to the fill swatch height.

arguments.name: SORTORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order to use for the legend entry labels.

arguments.name: TITLE=
arguments.description: specifies a title for the legend.

arguments.name: TITLEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the title.

arguments.name: VALUEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the legend value labels.

statements.name: PIE
statements.description: Creates a pie chart with slices representing counts or percents of unique category values. If a RESPONSE variable is specified, the chart summarizes the category values over corresponding values of the RESPONSE variable.

arguments.name: category-variable
arguments.description: specifies the column for the category values.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a discrete attribute map data set.

arguments.name: DATALABELATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the color and font attributes of the slice labels.

arguments.name: DATALABELDISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies the information to display in the slice labels.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: displays all available information

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: does not display slice labels

arguments.name: CATEGORY
arguments.description: displays the category value.

arguments.name: RESPONSE
arguments.description: displays the sum of the response value for each category.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: displays the response or category percentage.

arguments.name: DATALABELLOC=
arguments.description: specifies whether to display the slice labels within the pie slices or outside of the pie circumference.

arguments.name: INSIDE
arguments.description: locates the slice labels inside the pie slices.

arguments.name: OUTSIDE
arguments.description: locates the slice labels outside of the pie circumference.

arguments.name: CALLOUT
arguments.description: locates the slice labels outside of the pie circumference and draws a line from the label to its slice.

arguments.name: DATASKIN=
arguments.description: enhances the visual appearance of the filled pie slices.
arguments.help: DATASKIN=NONE | CRISP | GLOSS | MATTE | PRESSED | SHEEN

arguments.name: DIRECTION=
arguments.description: specifies whether to display the donut slices in counterclockwise or clockwise sequence.

arguments.name: FILLPATTERN
arguments.description: enables the display of line fill patterns for the chart.

arguments.name: MAXSLICES=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of slices in the pie. Any remaining slices are consolidated into the Other slice.

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: shows the data for missing category values.

arguments.name: NOFILL
arguments.description: turns off the display of fill colors.

arguments.name: OTHERFILLATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill color and transparency of the Other slice.

arguments.name: OTHERLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a label for the Other slice.

arguments.name: OTHERPERCENT=
arguments.description: collects all category values with response values less than or equal to percent-of-total into the Other slice.

arguments.name: RESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable for the response values.

arguments.name: SLICEORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the order of the pie slices.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: draws the slices in data order.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: draws the slices in ascending order of the formatted category variable.

arguments.name: UNFORMATTED
arguments.description: draws the slices in ascending order of the unformatted category variable.

arguments.name: RESPASC
arguments.description: draws the slices in ascending summed order of the response variable.

arguments.name: RESPDESC
arguments.description: draws the slices in descending summed order of the response variable.

arguments.name: STARTANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies which degree between 0 and 360 serves as the starting position for the first slice.

arguments.name: STARTPOS=
arguments.description: specifies whether the center or the edge of the slice is positioned at the start angle.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: specifies the format of the displayed statistical value.

arguments.name: TIP=
arguments.description: specifies the data tip information to be displayed when the cursor is positioned over the graphics element.

arguments.name: (variable-list)
arguments.description: a space-separated list of variables enclosed in parentheses.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses the data tips from this chart.

arguments.name: TIPFORMAT=
arguments.description: applies formats to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TIPLABEL=
arguments.description: applies labels to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies an HTML page to be displayed when parts of the plot are selected.

arguments.name: character-variable
arguments.description: specifies a variable that contains a valid HTML page reference (HREF) for each plot element that is to have an active link.

statements.name: STYLEATTRS
statements.description: Specifies attributes for a graph. The statement enables you to change the appearance of some graphics elements within the procedure.

arguments.name: BACKCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the background color of the graph area.

arguments.name: DATACOLORS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill colors for the graphics elements.

arguments.name: DATACONTRASTCOLORS=
arguments.description: specifies the contrast colors for the fill pattern, if used.

arguments.name: DATAFILLPATTERNS=
arguments.description: specifies the list of graph fill patterns.

arguments.name: fill-pattern-list
arguments.description: a space-separated list of fill patterns, enclosed in parentheses.

statements.name: ATTRIB
statements.description: Associates a format, informat, label, and length with one or more variables.

arguments.name: variable-list
arguments.description: names the variables that you want to associate with the attributes.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: associates a format with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: INFORMAT=
arguments.description: associates an informat with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: associates a label with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LENGTH=
arguments.description: specifies the length of variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: TRANSCODE=
arguments.description: specifies whether character variables can be transcoded. Use TRANSCODE=NO to suppress transcoding. Variables with TRANSCODE=NO are not returned.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable that the procedure uses to form BY groups. You can specify more than one variable. If you do not use the NOTSORTED option in the BY statement, then either the observations in the data set must be sorted by all the variables that you specify, or they must be indexed appropriately. Variables in a BY statement are called BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order. The observations are grouped in another way (for example, chronological order).

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: names one or more variables for SAS to associate with a format. You must specify at least one variable.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: specifies the format that is listed for writing the values of the variables.

arguments.name: DEFAULT=
arguments.description: specifies a temporary default format for displaying the values of variables that are not listed in the FORMAT statement. These default formats apply only to the current DATA step; they are not permanently associated with variables in the output data set.

statements.name: LABEL
statements.help:
Form 1: Creates a descriptive label for one or more variables.
LABEL variable-1=’text-string’ < ...variable-n=’text-string>; 
Form 2: Removes the label from one or more variables.
LABEL variable-1 = ' ' < ...variable-n=’ ‘>; | variable-1 = < ...variable-n= >

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: specifies a label of up to 256 bytes.
removes a label from a variable. Enclose a single blank space in quotation marks to remove an existing label. You can remove labels from multiple variables in a single LABEL statement:

statements.name: WHERE
statements.description: Subsets the input data set by specifying certain conditions that each observation must meet before it is available for processing.

arguments.name: where-expression
arguments.description: is an arithmetic or logical expression that generally consists of a sequence of operands and operators. For more information about where processing, see .
